ptdb.kernel.database

Class OracleXMLDBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptdb.kernel.database.OracleXMLDBConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DBConnection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RebuildReferenceFile

    public class OracleXMLDBConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBConnection
    Create and manage the actual connection to the Oracle XML database. Manage the transactions for the database.

    This is a wrapper class that acts as a Facade to the Oracle Berkeley XML Database interface.

    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Ashwini Bijwe, Yousef Alsaeed
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (abijwe)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (abijwe)

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static com.sleepycat.db.Environment _environment
      The environment for the Oracle Berkeley XMLDatabase that defines the parameters like cache size, locking mechanism, storing mechanism etc.
      protected static java.lang.String _environmentPath
      Path for the given environment.
      protected boolean _isConnectionAlive
      Denote whether the database connection is active or not.
      protected boolean _isTransactionActive
      Denote whether the database connection is active or not.
      protected DBConnectionParameters _params
      This object contains the parameters like path, container name etc.
      protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlContainer _xmlContainer
      This is the Oracle Berkeley XML DB Container that is used to add and remove documents.
      protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlManager _xmlManager
      This is the Oracle BerkeleyXML DB manager that is used to execute queries over the opened container.
      protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlTransaction _xmlTransaction
      This is the Oracle Berkeley XML DB Transaction that is used to commit or abort certain transactions.

    • Field Detail

      • _environment

        protected static com.sleepycat.db.Environment _environment
        The environment for the Oracle Berkeley XMLDatabase that defines the parameters like cache size, locking mechanism, storing mechanism etc. required for creating a database connection.

      • _environmentPath

        protected static java.lang.String _environmentPath
        Path for the given environment.

      • _isConnectionAlive

        protected boolean _isConnectionAlive
        Denote whether the database connection is active or not.

      • _isTransactionActive

        protected boolean _isTransactionActive
        Denote whether the database connection is active or not.

      • _params

        protected DBConnectionParameters _params
        This object contains the parameters like path, container name etc. required to connect with the database.

      • _xmlContainer

        protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlContainer _xmlContainer
        This is the Oracle Berkeley XML DB Container that is used to add and remove documents.

      • _xmlManager

        protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlManager _xmlManager
        This is the Oracle BerkeleyXML DB manager that is used to execute queries over the opened container.

      • _xmlTransaction

        protected com.sleepycat.dbxml.XmlTransaction _xmlTransaction
        This is the Oracle Berkeley XML DB Transaction that is used to commit or abort certain transactions. This will be set only if a transaction enabled connection is requested.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
                     throws DBConnectionException
        Commit the transaction and close the connection to the database.

        If the transaction on this connection is alive/open while closing the connection, the transaction will be aborted.

        Specified by:
        closeConnection in interface DBConnection
        Throws:
        DBConnectionException - If thrown while closing database connection.

      • executeCreateModelTask

        public java.lang.String executeCreateModelTask(CreateModelTask task)
                                        throws DBExecutionException,
                                               ModelAlreadyExistException,
                                               CircularDependencyException
        Execute the necessary commands to create a new model in the database according to the model specification given in the task parameter.
        Specified by:
        executeCreateModelTask in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - The task to be completed. In this case, CreateModelTask. This will tell the DB layer to create a new model in the database.
        Returns:
        The Id of the newly created model in the database.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - Thrown if there is a problem executing the task.
        ModelAlreadyExistException - Thrown if the model being created already exists.
        CircularDependencyException - If thrown while creating reference string.

      • executeGetFirstLevelParents

        public java.util.List<XMLDBModel> executeGetFirstLevelParents(GetFirstLevelParentsTask task)
                                                       throws DBExecutionException
        Execute the given task to fetch the first level parents for the given model. First level parents are models that are immediate parents for the given model.
        Specified by:
        executeGetFirstLevelParents in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - Task that contains the model for which the first level parents list needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        List of models that are the first-level parents of the given model.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - If thrown while fetching the parents list from the database.

      • executeAttributeSearchTask

        public java.util.ArrayList<XMLDBModel> executeAttributeSearchTask(AttributeSearchTask task)
                                                           throws DBExecutionException
        Search models that contain the given attributes in the database.
        Specified by:
        executeAttributeSearchTask in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - Task that contains a list of attributes that need to be searched in the database.
        Returns:
        List of models that contain the attributes; Empty list if the search returns zero results; and Null list if the search is not performed due to empty or invalid search criteria.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - If thrown while searching in the database.

      • executeRenameModelTask

        public void executeRenameModelTask(RenameModelTask task)
                            throws DBConnectionException,
                                   DBExecutionException,
                                   ModelAlreadyExistException,
                                   DBModelNotFoundException
        Execute rename model task which will change the name of the model in the database and reflect the change in the reference file.
        Specified by:
        executeRenameModelTask in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - RenameModelTask object that contains the XMLDBModel object and the new name.
        Throws:
        DBConnectionException - Thrown if there was a problem with the connection.
        DBExecutionException - Thrown if there is a problem in executing the task.
        DBModelNotFoundException - Thrown if the model with the name to be changed does not exist.
        ModelAlreadyExistException - Thrown if the new name is a name of a model that is already in the database.

      • executeUpdateAttributeTask

        public void executeUpdateAttributeTask(UpdateAttributeTask task)
                                throws DBExecutionException
        Execute update attribute task to update a given attribute in the database.
        Specified by:
        executeUpdateAttributeTask in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - The task that holds the attribute to be updated.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - Thrown if the operation fails with an error.

      • executeUpdateModelInCache

        public void executeUpdateModelInCache(XMLDBModel xmlDBModel)
                               throws DBExecutionException
        Execute the necessary commands to update the cache with the given model.

        If the model exists, replace it with the new model.
        If the model does not exist, save it in the cache.

        Specified by:
        executeUpdateModelInCache in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        xmlDBModel - The model object that needs to be added to the cache.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - Thrown if the operation fails. already exists.

      • executeUpdateParentsToNewVersion

        public void executeUpdateParentsToNewVersion(UpdateParentsToNewVersionTask task)
                                      throws DBExecutionException
        Execute the given task to update the referenced version for the given parents from the old model to the new model.
        Specified by:
        executeUpdateParentsToNewVersion in interface DBConnection
        Parameters:
        task - Task that contains the list of parents, the old model and the new model.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - If thrown while updating the parents in the database.
